intro: Lastrea cosmopolita, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its compact size and long-lasting blooms. Its ability to thrive in indoor conditions makes it a favored choice for gardeners and plant enthusiasts.
